ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to work seamlessly as a team to craft a well-informed and relevant deliverable for our client, the Wilson Center. Throughout the process of the Capstone, I also learned how to productively question the status quo when interviewing stakeholders.

I developed an in-depth understanding of the purpose, mission, and current state of the OSCE, as well as a broad grasp of the current European security architecture. I also strengthened my teamwork skills, collaborating with 8 other students on a final paper and presentation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was excellent! Our Capstone team bonded and supported each other throughout the process. I think a key part of our success was that we consistently met outside of class time to work together, in-person, on our deliverables.

A strength of this course was traveling to Vienna! Travel is a major strength of the capstone course and allows you to speak with key stakeholders and gain a unique, nuanced perspective on your issue that would otherwise be impossible from New Haven.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The Capstone is an excellent opportunity. Not only do you get to become an expert in your field of study as you prepare your deliverable, but you will also have the opportunity to bond with other Global Affairs majors and learn from your Capstone Advisor.

Yes! I loved my capstone. The project was incredibly interesting, and I was so lucky to work with such a committed group of students and with an awesome instructor. The course provided amazing opportunities to meet with high-level staff and leaders at the OSCE, and it was one of the most engaging learning experiences I've had.
